00036 class SpecPxCache {
00037 public:
00038    SpecPxCache(int cacheLen)
00039    {
00040       len = cacheLen;
00041       values = new float[len];
00042       valid = false;
00043    }
00044 
00045    ~SpecPxCache()
00046    {
00047       delete[] values;
00048    }
00049 
00050    sampleCount  len;
00051    float       *values;
00052    bool         valid;
00053 };

00058 class AUDACITY_DLL_API WaveClip: public XMLTagHandler
00059 {
00060 private:
00061    WaveClip(WaveClip& orig)
00062    {
00063       wxMessageBox(wxT("Fatal error - please report to audacity-devel@lists.sourceforge.net\n"));
00064    }

00066 public:
00067    // typical constructor
00068    WaveClip(DirManager *projDirManager, sampleFormat format, int rate);
00069 
00070    // essentially a copy constructor - but you must pass in the
00071    // current project's DirManager, because we might be copying
00072    // from one project to another

00080    int GetRate() const { return mRate; }
00081    
00082    // Set rate without resampling. This will change the length of the clip
00083    void SetRate(int rate) { mRate = rate; MarkChanged(); }
00084    
00085    // Resample clip. This also will set the rate, but without changing
00086    // the length of the clip
00087    bool Resample(int rate, ProgressDialog *progress = NULL);
00088

00090    double GetOffset() const { return mOffset; }
00091    void Offset(double delta) { SetOffset(GetOffset() + delta); }

00107    // but use more high-level functions inside WaveClip (or add them if you
00108    // think they are useful for general use)
00109    Sequence* GetSequence() { return mSequence; }
